title: Is it true that Elvis Presley stopped sleeping with Pricilla Presley after she gave birth to their daughter? - Quora

response.answer_text: True. Elvis was sexually repulsed by a woman who had become a mother. At that point he would stop any sexual connect between them. This was true with Priscilla. An association would begin (in Elvis’ psyche), between any mother, and HIS mother. It came too close to “feeling” he was being sexual with his mom. I think it’s fair to assume Elvis never tried psychological counseling.  Elvis had a lot of loss early in life. His relationship with his mother was intense and likely riddled with emotional difficulties. Very generally, when boys are young, they do what their mothers ask them to. They help and are rewarded with affection and praise. But there’s a point when a boy instinctively begins to model his father (shaves with a bit of cardboard, etc). I don’t believe Elvis made that singular switch, and didn’t stop trying to please his mother. A mother who allows this to happen is often narcissistic, she wants to hold on to her son, as long as she can (forsaking her husband emotionally and sexually). As a result, the son ends up tied to his narcissistic mother, who believes everything is all about her and after that, her son. It’s the genesis of Elvis’ sexual difficulties. For more on this read “Elvis Presley: A Southern Life”, by Joel Williamson. One of the things which precipitated Priscilla’s affair with Mike Stone, is that Priscilla wanted to try for a boy but Elvis wanted to go on tour. Elvis already had at least one illegitimate daughter that he knew of, and one son whom he named Tommy after Col. Parker. The lyricist knew about this when writing Don’t Cry Daddy: Don't cry, daddyDaddy, please don't cryDaddy, you've still got me and little TommyAnd together we'll find a brand new mommy… Altogether, was the father of about 9 children, including a son named Philipp (? spelling) who has changed his name to Elvis Aaron Presley Jr.
